intro: Leptoderris congolensis var. quinquefoliolata, commonly known as the five-leafed leptoderris, is a tropical plant native to Central Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which typically consist of five leaflets arranged in a pinnate pattern. It produces small, white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
